á: durative aspect; ááyo’kaawa he’s sleeping; káta’yáyo’kááwaatsiksi? Is he sleeping?
aaáhs: elder relation (grandparent, parent-in-law, paternal aunt/uncle, husband’s older brother, etc.); naaáhsiksi my grandparents; maaáhsi her paternal aunt.
aaápan: blood; aaápaistsi blood (plural); nitsáápani my blood; mi’ksáápani red blood.
ááat: move/walk in relation to; míístapáaatsisa walk away from him!; áóhsááattsiiyaawa they are walking so there is room between them and the other, either by walking around or backing away; áako’takááatsiiyaawa they will surround them/him; íístapááatsiiwáyi she moved from him; nitsíístapááakka she moved from me; Note: adt req; cf. oo.+at.
ááattsistaa: rabbit; ááattsistaiksi rabbits; nitááattsistaama my rabbit; pokááattsistaawa baby rabbit; omahkááattsistaawa jackrabbit.
aaattsistaotsipiiis: rabbit brush, Latin: Chrysothamnus nauseosus (Taylor); áaattsistaotsipíiistsi rabbit brush plants.
ááhk: might/non-factive; nitsííksstaa nááhksoy’ssi I wish to eat; ááhksstsisoowa she might have gone to town.
ááhkamá’p: might; ááhkamá’pisamssiwa he might take awhile; ááhkamá’pihtsisoowa she might go to town; nááhkamá’pito’too I might go there.
aahkiáapiksistsiko: going home day (a day mid-way between summer solstice and winter solstice); init. var. of waahkiáapiksistsiko; cf. waahki.
aahkioohsa’tsis: boat; otááhkioohsa’tsiistsi his boats; otááhkioohsa’tsiimoaawayi their very own boat; cf. yaahkioohsi. aahkóinnimaan nin; pipe; otááhkóinnimaanistsi his pipes.
ááhko’sskaan: gifts of livestock or dry goods to in-laws; otááhko’sskaani his gift to his in-laws; cf. waahko’sskaa.
aahksikkam: might; ááhksikkamsstsisoowa she might go/have gone to town; nááhksikkamssksinii’pa I might know it; cf. aahk+ikkam.
ááhksikkama’p: might; ááhksikkama’psstsisoowa she might go to town.
aahs: pleasing; see yaahs. ááhso(w)a nan; burr, Latin: Glycyrrhiza lepida (Taylor: wild licorice); ómahkahsoaiksi big burrs.
áak: future; áakokska’siwa he will run; káta’yáakokska’síwaatsiksi will he run?; máátáaksoyiwaatsiksi he’s not going to eat.
aakááapioyis: Fort Macleod; cf. waaka+naapioyis. aakáíksamaiksi nin; old agency.
aakáíksimonniipokaa: id: illegitimate child (lit.: many secret fathers child); akáíksimonniipokaiksi illegitimate children; cf. waaka+iksim+onni+pookaa.
aakáísatstsaa: Hudson’s Bay blanket (lit.: many-striped/layered); akáísatstsaiksi Hudson’s Bay blankets; nitakáísatstsááimiksi my Hudson’s Bay blanket; cf. waaka+saatstsaa.
aakáísta’ao: Blood clan name: many ghosts/spirits; cf. aaká+sta’ao. aakáítapissko nin; town (lit.: place of many people); aakáítapisskoistsi towns; Miistsáákaitapissko (lit.: wood-town) Arrowwood, Alberta (Siksika dialect)/ Glenwood, Alberta (Blood dialect).
aakáókiinaa: Blood clan name, ‘many graves’/ burial caches above the ground; akáókiinaiksi many graves above the ground clan; cf. waaká+okiin.
aakawoo: be many; init. var. of waakawoo.
aakiaaahs: mother-in-law; nitáákiaaahsiksi my mothers-in-law; otáákiaaahsi his/her mother-in-law; dialect var. aakiiyaaahs; cf. aakíí+maaáhs.
aakíí: woman/queen (card); aakííksi women; see kipitáaakii old woman.
fringed sage, Latin: Artemisia frigida; aakííka’ksimiiyistsi fringed sages; dialect var. aakiika’ksimo; cf. aakii+ka’ksimo. aakííkoan nan; girl; i’nákaakííkoaiksi little girls; nitáákiikoama my girlfriend.
áákiim: sister/ female cousin of a male (includes insst and female isskan); nitáákiimiksi my (male speaker) sisters; otáákiimiksi his sisters and female cousins; nimáátaakiima she’s not my sister/female cousin.
aakíípasskaan: women’s dance; aakíípasskaanistsi women’s dances; dialect var. aakíípaisskaan; syn. o’taksipasskaan; cf. aakíí+ipasskaa.
aakíssi: get water; init. var. of waakissi.
ááksi’ksaahko: bank, embankment, cliff; sspáksi’ksááhkoistsi high cliffs/ cut banks.
aaksta’: interrogative prefix (future); áakstao’ohkaaniiwa? will she object?; cf. aak+sta’.
aamio’kakiikinaattsi: muskrat root (bitter root), Latin: Acorus calamus; áámio’kakiikinaattsiistsi muskrat roots; non-init. variant omio’kakiikinaattsi, cf. mamii+o’kakiikin+inaattsi.
aamsskááp: south; init. var. of waamsskaap. aamsskáápipikani nan; South Piikani (band of the Blackfoot tribe); Amsskáápipikaniikoaiksi Southern Piikani persons; cf. waamsskaap+piikani.
aan: shawl/ robe; nitsísttohksaaniksi my light shawls; nítsspiksísttohksaana my thick shawl; Note: adt req.
aanáó’kitapiikoan: half-breed man (of any racial combinations); aanáó’kitapiikoaiksi half-breed men; cf. waanao’k+matapi+ikoan. aanáttsii nin; light; assáaksssá’tsit ómistsi aanáttsiistsi! take a look at those lights!; cf. waanattsii.
aaná’kimaa’tsis: light, lantern; aaná’kimaa’tsiistsi lights; cf. waana’kimaa.
aanist: manner; kitáakanistótsspi the way you will swim; niitáótso’pi the way we swim; iihtáítsinikiwa maanistá’poohpi she told stories of how she travelled; see niitsii be the case.
aanistaiisi: be so/happen; ákanistaiisiwa it has happened; Rel. stem: vii aanistsii be so.
aanistaimmiyi: think of as; tsááhtaw nááhkanistaimmiyihpi I wonder what he thinks of me.
aanistápanissin: mean/signify; tsá anistápanissina? what does it mean?
aanistápaoo: step aside; init. var. of waanistápaoo.
aanistápii: be (identity); tsá aanistápiiwaatsi what is it?; Rel. stem: vai aanistápssi be.
aanistá’pii: be a way/happen; tsá aanistá’piiwaaatsi how is it?; Rel. stem: vai aanistá’pssi be.
aanistsii: be so, come true; áakanistsiiwa it will be so; ákaanistsiiwa it has been fulfilled.
aanistsimm: think of as; nitáakanistsimmaawa mááhkssoka’psssi I will think of him as good; skáa’nistsimmaawa áísáyiwa/mááhkssayssi it might be that he’s lying; nitsikánistsimmoka … he thinks of me as ….
aanistsinaattsi: appear as; init. var. of waanistsinaattsi.
aanistsoo: be so much; nimáátssksiniihpa maanístsoohpi … I don’t know how much …; Note: requires unspecified subject.
aapaawapsspi: huckleberry, Latin: Vaccinium membranaceum ? (Taylor); áápaawapsspiistsi huckleberries; cf. áápaiai+moapssp.
aapáíai: common cattail, Latin: Typha latifolia; aapáíaistsi common cattails; Aapaiáísskowa Cattail Valley (a.k.a. Weasel Tail Valley); syn. makóyoohkat.
áápaiai: ermine/ weasel (in winter coat), Latin: Mustela erminea; ksikkáápaiaiksi white weasels; nitáápaiaiima my weasel; dialect var. áápaa; syn. ootáá.
aapáíaitapi: Bullrushes or Cattail Clan (Piikani); Aapaiáítapiiksi Bullrushes or Cattail Clan/ members of the Bullrushes or Cattail Clan.
aapám: across water; see aapamoo cross water; aapámoohtsi on the other side of the water.
aapamoo: go across water; aapámóót! go across the water!; nitáakopamóo I’ll cross the water; init. variant of opamoo. aapámiaapiikoan nan; European (lit.: across (the ocean) person); Aapámiaapiikoaiksi Europeans.
áápaokomi: horse with white neck markings; áápaokomiiksi horses with white neck markings; áápaokomisskiima female horse with white neck markings.
aapaooki: sharp stone used as a knife or spearhead; aapáóókiistsi sharp stones (used as knives or spearheads).
aapát: behind, back; init. var. of waapat. áápataamsstsinnimaa nan; Chinese person (lit.: braids in back); áápatáámsstsinnimaiksi persons of Chinese ancestry; cf. aapát+yaamsstsinni.
aapátataksáakssin: truck box or a type of wagon (lit.: box in the back); aapátataksáakssiistsi truck boxes; cf. waapat+ataksaakssin. aapátohkat nin; hind leg; otápatohkatsistsi his hind legs; cf. ohkat. aapátohsaapiikoan nan; Canadian; (Blackfeet dialect); cf. waapatohs+naapiikoan.
aapátohsipikáni: North Peigan, Piikani; Aapátohsipikaniikoaiksi members of the Piikani Band; dialect var. Apátohsipiikani; cf. waapatohsi+Piikani.
aapátsínnapisi: snowshoe (varying) hare (lit.: long hind legs), Latin: Lepus americanus; aapátsínnapisiiksi snowshoe (varying) hares; cf. waapat+inno+apisi.
aapatssaissksika: grebe (lit.: leg grows in the back), Latin: Podicipedidae; aapátssaissksikaiksi grebes.
aapátsstaan: the back apron of a breech-cloth; aapátsstaanistsi the back aprons of breech-cloths; Note: nan for some speakers.
áápi: white/light-colored; áápinikimma white berry; see áápiipissoohsi marsh hawk; init. var. of waapi.
aapiakonsski: rocky mountain jay (lit.: has a white forehead), Latin: Perisoreus canadensis capitalis; áápiakonsskiiksi rocky mountain jays; cf. monsskis.
áápii: albino/ white one; omahkáápiiksi big albinos; áápiikoana white buffalo calf.
áápiikayi: skunk, Latin: Mephitis mephitis; ómahkápiikayiiksi big skunks; nitápiikayiima my skunk.
aapiiksístsimaohkinni: member of the White Bead Necklace Society; Aapiiksístsimaohkinniiksi White Bead Necklace Society/ members of the White Bead Necklace Society; cf. aapii+ksiistsimaan+ohkinni.
áápiinikimm: berry of the red osier, Latin: Cornus stolonifera / snowberry fruit; áápiinikimmiksi white berries; syn. mi’kapikssoyiis (red dog-wood/ red osier); see siinikskaahko snowberry; cf. aapi.
aapíínima’tsis: a general, collective name for medicinal herbs; apíínima’tsiistsi medicinal herbs; nopíínima’tsiistsi my medicinal herbs.
aapiipíssoohsi: marsh hawk (lit.: white belt), Latin: Circus cyaneus; aapiipíssoohsiiksi marsh hawks.
áápikíítokii: white-tailed ptarmigan (lit.: white tough-skin(?)), Latin: Lagopus leucurus; áápikíítokiiksi white-tailed ptarmigans; cf. aapi+kiitoki.
aapíksssin: skin eruption, sore; sikapíksssini smallpox (lit.: black skin eruption); ómahkápiksssini big skin eruption (possibly chicken pox); see mi’kotsáápiksssin measles; cf. waapikssi.
aapinákoisisttsii: snow bunting (lit.: morning bird); aapinákoisisttsiiksi snow buntings.
aapinákos: tomorrow; aapinákoistsi future days; cf. waapinako+subjunctive.
aapini: eye; sohkapíni big eye; nitáísttsaapini I have an eye-ache.
aapistsísskitsaato’s: May (lit.: flower/blossom month); Aapistsísskitsaato’siksi Flower months.
aapistsisskitsi: flower/blossom; aapistsísskitsiistsi flowers; dialect var. aapitsisskitsi.
aapitsíkamaan: brace/ stick for support, (e.g. used to hang a pot over a fire); aapitsíkamaanistsi braces, supports; cf. waapitsikai. aapitsíkamaa’tsis nin; tripod (e.g. for hanging a ceremonial bundle or a cooking pot); otápitsikamaa’tsiistsi his tripods; cf. waapitsikai.
aapi’maan: makeshift (temporary) shelter; áápi’maanistsi makeshift shelters; cf. waapi’maa.
aapí’si: coyote, Latin: Canis latrans; ómahkapi’siiksi timber wolves (lit.: big coyotes).
aapí’soomitaa: German Shepherd (lit.: coyote-dog); aapí’soomitaiksi German Shepherd dogs; nitápi’soomitaama my German Shepherd dog. aapohkinniyi nan; kingfisher (lit.: has white necklace), Latin: Megaceryle alcyon; áápohkinniyiiksi kingfishers; cf. aapi+ohkinni. áápohkomii nan; Wilson’s phalarope (lit.: has a white-throat?), Latin: Steganopus tricolor; áápohkomiiksi Wilson’s phalaropes; cf. aapi. áápomahkihkinaa nan; mountain goat (lit.: white sheep), Latin: Oreamnos americanus; áápomahkihkinaiksi mountain goats.
áápotskina: cow; áápotskinaiksi cows; nitáápotskinaama my cow.
aapotskinaisahkomaapi: cowboy (lit.: cow-boy); áápotskinaisahkómaapiiksi cowboys; cf. saahkomaapi. áápo’pihkaa’tsis nin; pore fungus, Latin: Polyporus sp. (Taylor). áápsksisi nan; horse with white facial marking, blaze (lit.: white nose); pokápsksisiiksi little horses with white facial markings; cf. hksis. aapssííkam nan; whooping crane, Latin: Grus americana; aapssííkamiksi whooping cranes.
aapssííyi’kayi: platinum mink, Latin: Mustela vison; aapssííyi’kayiiksi mink (plural); cf. siiyi’kayi.
aapssipisttoo: snowy owl (lit.: white night announcer (Piikani)), Latin: Nyctea scandiaca; áápssipisttoiksi snowy owls; dialect var. aapiisipisttoo; cf. siipisttoo.
aapsskí: horse with white facial marking/ whiteface; sikápsskiiksi black horses with white facial markings; cf. sski.
áápsspini: Canada goose (lit.: white chin), Latin: Branta canadensis; áápsspiniiksi Canada geese.
aatako: the previous evening; matakóístsi past evenings.
aatoksípistaan: tipi frame made up of four poles tied together; aatoksípistaanistsi tipi frames; cf. waatoksipistaa. aato. adt; holy/sacred; init. var. of waato. .
aatsímoyihkaan: prayer, religion; aatsímoyihkaanistsi prayers; nitatsímoyihkaani my religion; cf. waatsimoyihkaa. aawaiipisstsiimsskaa nan; Navajo (lit.: weaver); ááwaiipisstsiimsskaiksi Navajos; iitawaiipisstsiimsskao’pa the area inhabited by any of the southwestern tribes/ also used for Pendleton, Oregon.
aawakksaawani: Belted kingfisher (lit.: irregular flight), Latin: Megaceryle alcyon; aawákksaawaniiksi kingfishers.
aawákksis: chewing gum; ómahkawákksiiksi big wads of chewing gum; nitawákksisa my chewing gum.
aawápsspiinao’sa’tsis: glasses; sikawapsspiinao’sa’tsiiksi black eyeglasses; nitawapsspiinao’sa’tsiiksi my eyeglasses; cf. aawapsspiinao’si.
aawapsspiinao’si: wear eyeglasses; awápsspiinao’sit! wear eyeglasses!; áakawapsspiinao’siwa she will …; ááwapsspiinao’siwa he wears eyeglasses; nitáwapsspiinao’si I wear eyeglasses; ííkaawapsspiinao’sskaawa he had bought glasses.
aawápsspiinao’sskaa: acquire eyeglasses; aawápsspiinao’sskaat! get eyeglasses!; áakawapsspiinao’sskaawa she will …; aawápsspiinao’sskaawa he acquired eyeglasses; nitááwapsspiinao’sskaa I got eyeglasses.
ááwowáakii: male homosexual (term not necessarily pejorative); ááwowáakiiksi male homosexuals; cf. waawo.+aakii.
aawoyihtsi: not at right angles/ uneven/ misaligned; áakaawoyihtsiwa it will not be at a right angle; ááwoyihtsiwa it is not at a right angle; cf. waawo. .
ááyí’sipissaa: pelican (lit.: carries water); ááyí’sipissaiksi pelicans; cf. waayi’sipissaa; dialect var. waayi’sipisaa.
aayí’sipisaan: liquid carried in a storage container, e.g. canteen, thermos; aayí’sipisaanistsi liquids carried in storage containers; cf. waayi’sipisaa. áa’si vii; be a mile; áaksisto’káa’siwa it will be two miles; ni’táa’siwa it is/ was one mile; dialect var. áaasi(?); Note: adt req.
ahkanaapitt: make cuts on the body of (for Sundance); nítahkanaapikkoowa I was cut for the Sundance.
ahkiaapamm: invite home; ahkiáápammis invite him home!; nitáakahkiaapammawa I’ll invite him to my home.
ahkiaapapohkat: take food home for; nitáakahkiaapapohkatawa naaáhsa I’ll take food home for my grandmother; cf. ahkiaap+waapohkat.
ahsinat: perceive; miináttsikimmatahsinatsisa! do not pity him anymore!, (i.e. do not perceive him as being pitiable again!); áakokahsinatsiiwáyi she will have a bad impression of him; iipístahsinatsiiwáyi he perceived her as being strange/odd; nitsiikókahsinakka she has a bad impression of me; Note: adt req.
aiist: to location; ákaaistoowa he has come; see aiistoo. aiistoo vai; approach speaker’s location;; aiistóót! come here!
aiistohko: approach; áíistohkoos! approach him!; áíistohkóókit! come closer to me!; Rel. stems: vti aiistohki, vii aiistaihtsiiyi approach.
aiitoohtsimi: understand Blackfoot (Indian language); (aiitoohtsimit!) (understand Blackfoot!); áakaiitoohtsimiwa she will …; áíitoohtsimiwa she understands Blackfoot; nitáíitoohtsimi I understand Blackfoot; nikáíitoohtsimi I have understood Blackfoot.
áíkaanaisskiinaohtooki: double bladder pod, Latin: Physaria didymocarpa (Taylor); cf. kaanaisskiinaa+mohtookis; Note: gender uncertain.
áíkayissaissapi: scout; áíkayissaissapiiksi scouts; syn. aokaki’tsi; cf. ikayiss+a+ssapi.
áíkayisaisttoom: prophet, one who predicts the future; cf. saisttoo; dialect var. áíkayissanistoom.
áíkkakiiyi: have a limp; áíkkakiiyit! limp!; áakaikkakiiyiwa she will limp; áíkkakiiyiwa he limps; nitáíkkakiiyi I limp; dialect var. aikkaki’yi; Note: stative.
áíkkaniksipii’p: sail (billows); áíkkaniksipii’pistsi sails; nitsíkkaniksipii’pi my sail; dialect var. áíkkaniksii’p.
áíkkatoo’p: balloon; ómahkáíkkatoo’pistsi big balloons; nitáíkkatoo’pi; my balloon; cf. ikkatoo.
áíksikkominsstsiikin: brown trout (lit.: white sleeves), Latin: Salmo trutta; áíksikkominsstsiikiiksi brown trout (plural).
áíksikkooki: bear grass (lit.: sharp stem), Latin: Yucca glauca. áíksikksiksi(s) nin; bitterroot, Latin: Lewisia rediviva (Taylor); Note: used to make cough syrup, or chewed for coughs; cf. ksikk+iksis.
áíksikkssksisi: coot (lit.: has white nose), Latin: Fulica americana; áíksikkssksisiiksi coots; cf. ksikk+hsis.
áíksini: pig; ómahkaiksiniiksi big pigs; nitáíksiniima my pig. aiksinoosak nan; bacon; áíksinóósakiksi bacon (slabs or slices of); cf. oosak. áíksinottsis nin; pork sausage; áíksinaotsiistsi sausages; cf. aiksini+mottsis. áiksippoyínnii’p nin; sponge; áíksippoyínnii’pistsi sponges; cf. iksippoyinni. aiksippoyinnomoa nan; milk cow; áíksippoyinnomoaiksi milk cows. aiksisooki nin; yucca, soapweed, Latin: Yucca glauca (Taylor); áíksisookiistsi soapweeds.
áíksisstáanattsii: electric light, flashlight; áíksisstáanattsiistsi flashlights; nitáíksisstáanattsiimi my flashlight; cf. iksissto+aanattsii. aiksisstoomatapisttsipatakkayayi nan; automobile; áíksisstoomatapisttsipatakkayayiiksi automobiles; cf. iksissto+omatap+isttsipatakkayayi.
áíksisstoomatokska’si: automobile; áíksisstoomatokska’siiksi automobiles; syn. áíksisstoomatoo, áíksisstoomatapisttsipatakkayayi, áíksisstoomatomaahkaa; cf. iksissto+iimat+okska’si.
aim: control/influence; see ohkottaimm; Note: forms vta.
áímmóniisi: otter, Latin: Lutra canadensis; ómahkáímmóniisiiksi big otters; nitáímmóniisiima my otter; dialect var. ámmoniisi.
áímmoyo’kiniomitaa: lion (lit.: fur chested dog); pokáímmoyo’kiniomitaiksi small lions; nitáímmoyo’kiniomitaama my lion; cf. immoyi +mo’kin+imitaa.
áínaka’si: wagon (lit.: it rolls); áínaka’siiksi wagons; cf. inaka’si. áípahpoyi nin; gelatin, gelatin pudding; áípahpoyiistsi gelatin puddings; cf. ipahpoyi.
áípahtsíkaimo: Northern Valerian, wild heliotropes, Latin: Valeriana septentrionalis; áípahtsíkaimoistsi heliotropes; dialect var. aipahksikaimo; cf. ipaht+ika+imo.
áípakkitaka’si: motorcycle; áípakkitaka’siiksi motorcycles; cf. ipakk. áípakkohsoyi nan; tractor (Piikani); áípakkohsoyiiksi tractors; cf. ipakk. áípakkohtamm nan; motorcycle (Piikani)/ tractor (Blood dialect); áípakkohtammiksi motorcycles/ tractors; cf. ipakk.
áípapomm: lightning; áípapommiksi lightning flashes; cf. ipapo. áípasstaamiinaamm nan; apple; var. of ápasstaamiinaamm. áípi’kssokinaki nan; shaman; áípi’kssokinakiiksi shamans; cf. sokinaki. áípottaa nin; airplane; áípottaistsi planes; cf. ipottaa.
áísaakotsii: bubbly beverage, e.g. pop or beer (lit.: foams or bubbles out); áísaakotsiistsi soft drinks or beer; cf. saakotsii.
áísaayoohkomi: bull; áísaayoohkomiiksi bulls; nitáísaayoohkomiima my bull.
áísaiksisto’simm: heat radiator/ heat vent; áísaiksisto’simmiksi heat radiators/vents; cf. sa+iksisto’si.
áísaipihkaisoka’sim: sweater (lit.: stretch clothing); máóhkáísaipihkaisoka’siistsi red sweaters; nitáísaipihkaisoka’simi my sweater; cf. saipihkaa+soka’sim.
áísaipihkáísttsomo’kaan: knitted hat, e.g. toque; ómahkáísaipihkaisttsomo’kaanistsi big knitted hats; nisáípihkaisttsomo’kaani my knitted hat.
áísaisttoo: announcer; ííkayaisaisttoiksi prophets; cf. saisttoo. áísátsaaki nan; carpenter, one who planes (e.g. wood); áísátsaakiiksi carpenters; ómahkáísátsaakiwa big carpenter;; syn. aokooysskaa; cf. satsaaki.
aisattsikohtako: lupine, Latin: Lupinus sp. (Taylor)/ silky loco, Latin: Oxytropis sericea (Taylor); áísattsikohtakoistsi lupines.
áísínaakiohpi: television; áísínaakiohpiiksi televisions; cf. sínaaki. áísínai’pi nin; Writing-On-Stone (now a provincial park) (lit.: it is pictured); dialect var. áísínaihpi; syn. iitssínaihpi where it is written; cf. á+sína. áísiníkiihp nan; sap; dialect var. áísiníkii’p.
áísokinaki: doctor; áísokinakiiksi doctors; cf. sokin. áísokinakiáakii nan; nurse/ female doctor; áísokinakiáákiiksi nurses.
áísopomitaka’si: electric fan; áísopomitaka’siiksi electric fans; cf. sopomi. áísooka adt; formerly; áísookaissksinimá’tstohkiwa he formerly taught. áísoyoopoksiikimi nin; tea (Siksika dialect) (lit.: dried leaf liquid); áísoyoopoksiikimiistsi teas; cf. ikimi.
áíssimihkaa: sniffer/ one who sniffs; cf. ssimihkaa. áíssimihkatoo’p nin; snuff.
áíssinnii’p: pasta (spaghetti, noodles, macaroni); áíssinnii’pistsi pastas; cf. ssinn.
aisskahs: always; áísskahsaitapoowa he always goes there; áakáísskahsawaasai’niwa she will always be crying; káátáísskahsita’pawaawahkaawa that is why he was always wandering around there; nitáísskahsáóoyi I’m always eating.
áísskssíinainikimm: rice (lit.: insect shaped); see isskssiinainikimm. áíssksinimá’tsaa nan; student; áíssksinimá’tsaiksi students; cf. ssksinima’tsi. áíssksinima’tstohki nan; teacher; áíssksinima’tstohkiiksi teachers; cf. ssksinima’tstohki.
áísspihka’si: (lit.: act high), id: affect snobbery or superiority; áísspihka’sit! act snobbish!; áakaisspihka’siwa she will …; áísspihka’siwa he acts as if he is superior; nitáísspihka’si I act snobbish; cf. sspi.
áísstssípoko: penstemon, Latin: Penstemon sp. (Taylor); cf. isstss+ipoko. áísttákoyii nin; liniment; áísttákoyiistsi liniments; nitáísttakoyiima my liniment; ótsskóísttákoyiiyi Absorbine Jr. (lit.: green liniment).
áítapióoyi: imaginary monstrous beast mentioned to frighten misbehaving children (lit.: people-eater); áítapióoyiiksi imaginary monsters; cf. matapi+ooyi.
áítapisskatsimaa: weather dancer, person who performs the Sundance ceremony (that takes place after the center pole has been raised); áítapisskatsimaiksi weather dancers; cf. itapisskatsimaa.
aitsikiihkaa: cobbler; áítsikiihkaiksi cobblers; cf. á+atsikin+hkaa. áítsiyihka’si nan; peacock, male turkey (gobbler); áítsiyihka’siiksi peacocks; cf. itsi. .
áí’pohto: move belongings of; áí’pohtoos! move him!; nitáí’pohtooka he moved my stuff; variant of wai’pohto.
áí’stamatsi: explain/demonstrate to; áí’stamatsookit! explain to me/ show me how!; nitáakai’stamatsaawa I’ll show him how; Rel. stem: vti áí’stamatstohkatoo demonstrate/explain.
ai’tamáak: almost complete; áí’tamáaksi’niwa he’s almost dead; áí’tamáako’toowa he’s almost here; dialect var. a’tamáak. aká adt; many; var. of waaka.
áka: old/ belonging to a former time/ ancient; akáa’piistsi old things; n+ikáákkaama my friend from the past; see ákaitapi people of old; áaksikaitapiitsinikiwa she will tell stories told by people of the past.
ákáá: perfect aspect/ completive; ákáái’niwa he has died; nikááyoomi I have a husband.
akaahtoipoyi: stand in a battle line (shoulder to shoulder for warfare); kaahtóípoyik! stand in a line!; áakakaahtoipoyiyaawa they will stand in a line; iikááhtoipoyiyaawa they stood in a line; nitsííkaahtoipoyihpinnaan we stood in line.
akáa’tsis: robe/ protection, power; nitakáa’tsiistsi my robes; Mai’stáákaa’tsisi Crow protection (name); cf. waaka’taki. akáa’tsis nin; lariat; nitokáa’tsiistsi my lariats; cf. okaa.
ákaitapii: person of the past; ákaitapiiwa our ancestors (as a group); cf. ákaa+itapiiyi.
akai’tsii: bright red ochre/paint; akai’tsiistsi bright red paints; nitakai’tsiiyi my bright red ochre; omoistsi akai’tsiistsi áístamsstsáómaohksinaattsiiyiyaawa those types of paints are bright red in color.
akakkahko: semi-circular/horse-shoe shaped ridge; akákkahkoistsi semi- circular/horse-shoe shaped ridges.
akákkoma’pii: be difficult and important; áakakákkoma’piiwa it will be difficult and …; akákkoma’piiwa nomohtáakotoinoahpi kitsínaiminnoona it (the reason) is difficult and important why I am going to see our leader/ boss; máátakakkoma’piiwa it is not difficult.
akim: place of honor; var. of ikim.
akisspí: deeper water; akísspiisowoot! go deeper/where it’s deeper!; nit(ak)sspísowóo I went further out in the water; nitaksspíaahkioohsi I boated further out; dialect var. isspí.
akí’kaan: camp; akí’kaanistsi/okí’kaanistsi camps; nitokí’kaani my camp; cf. oki’kaa.
akk: more (comparatively); ákkisstoyiwa it got colder; akkísspoohtsi, ánnimayi itáíhtsiwa there it is, higher up.
akkawa’pssi: have a large holding capacity; áakakkawa’pssiwa it will …; akkawá’pssiwa it has a large capacity; ma’tóósa áma nóóhko’sa, iikákkawa’pssiwa take my dish, it has a large capacity; Note: stative.
akkáyssksisi: shooting star, American cowslip (lit.: pug-nosed), Latin: Dodecatheon radicatum (Taylor); akkáyssksisiiksi shootings star plants.
akkáyssksisikaanaisskiinaa: pygmy shrew (lit.: pug-nosed mouse), Latin: Sorex hoyi; akkáyssksisikaanaisskiinaiksi pygmy shrews; cf. kaanaisskiinaa.
akoksska: of paramount rank; see akoksskaaapiikoan whiteman of paramount rank; akoksskainaawa man of paramount rank.
akoksskaaapiikoan: whiteman of paramount rank; akoksskaaapiikoaiksi whitemen of paramount rank; cf. naapiikoan. akomimm vta; love; init. var. of waakomimm.
akomí’tsimaan: favorite object or habit; otakomí’tsimaanistsi her favorite things; var. of waakomi’tsi.
ákookinssin: eye tooth, canine tooth (a conical pointed tooth), fang; ómahkakookinssiistsi big eye teeth; otákookinssini his eye tooth; dialect var. a’ko’kin.
akóópis: broth; akóópiistsi broths; dialect var. kóópis. akóópsskaan nin; soup; dialect var. akóópihkaan; cf. okoopihkaa.
aksipínnakssin: bow (for hunting or sport); pokaksipínnakssiistsi small bows; nitáksipínnakssini my bow.
aksipístaan: binding (usually rope) for main lodge poles.
aksistóóyinihkssin: motivating song, usually sung before a big event, e.g. a raid, or when one is feeling low in spirits; aksistóóyinihkssiistsi motivating songs; cf. inihki.
akspiáápiiniiwan: syrup; dialect var. akspiaapiiniowaan; cf. naapiiniiwan.
akspíí: gum plant, sticky weed, Latin: Grindelia squarrosa (used as a decongestant); akspíístsi sticky weeds; cf. okspii.
akssín: bed; akssíístsi beds; nitókssini my bed.
aksstsíí: seashell, shell of any shellfish; aksstsííksi seashells; dialect var. ksstsii.
akstsimá’tsis: abacus/counter/ adding machine; akstsimá’tsiiksi counters, adding machines; syn. iitaokstsimao’p.
am: this, proximity and familiarity to the speaker; amiksi these. ama adt; pitiful, pathetic; amáíppitáaakiiwa pathetic old woman. ámaahtsiksi und; This is the one? (mild surprise).
amáíipssim: belt; (a)máíipssiistsi belts; nomáíipssiistsi my belts; dialect var. (a)maipssim.
amaohkaapistsisskitsi: scarlet mallow, Latin: Sphaeralcea coccinea (Taylor); amáóhkaapistsisskitsiistsi scarlet mallows; cf. maohk+aapistsisskitsi.
ámaohksikim: rosehip root boiled for diarrhea/stomach upset/eyewash/ cough.
ami: be; áakamiwa it will be him; áámiwa it is/was him; ákaamiwa it’s him.
amínsstsiikin: sleeve; komínsstsiikiistsi your sleeves; innóóminsstsiikiistsi long sleeves.
amo: this, proximity to speaker but not to addressee; amo(i)stsi these.
amoonimaan: cigarette (ready-made); amóónimaanistsi cigarettes; nimóónimaanistsi my cigarettes; pokomóónimaani little cigarette; cf. omooni.
amopístaan: ceremonial bundle (religious); amopístaanistsi ceremonial bundles; nitomopístaani my bundle; otomopístaani his bundle.
ever; máátanawáí’poyiwaatsi he didn’t ever speak. anao’k adt; half; nitáakotsiihpa anáó’koohtsi I’ll take half of it. anááyi nan; banana; anááyiiksi bananas; (Siksika dialect). aná’kimaa’tsis nin; object which radiates artificial light, e.g. lamp; nitána’kimaa’tsiistsi my lamps; isstsána’kimaa’tsis torch; cf. waana’kimaa.
anistá’paistoto: take liberties with/ show no consideration for/ treat with disrespect/ regard as if; (sootam)anistá’paistotoosa! (just) treat him with no respect!; áakanistá’paistotoyiiwáyi she will treat him any old way, without respect; niitá’paistotoyiiwa ánni pookááyi he regarded her as if she were a child; nitanistá’paistotooka she treated me with no respect.
ánistsska’si: flaunt one’s advantage, be pretentious; (anistsska’sit!) (flaunt your advantage)!; áakanistsska’siwa she will …; ikánistsska’siwa he flaunted his advantage; nitsíkánistsska’si I flaunt my advantage; dialect var. anistaihka’si.
ann: that, proximity or familiarity to the addressee but no proximity to the speaker; anniksi those.
anná: where is (s)he?; anná annááhka kitána? where is your daughter? cf. ann.
annááistsaawa: where is it (inan.)?; cf. ann. annaam dem; the late …; ki annáám, annííska ónnisska, otssawomáóhka’pssi … and the late one, her father, before his passing …; anniim the late … (minor third person); cf. ann. annáatsiksi und; where is he/it (anim.)?
ánnia: that’s it/ is that so?; cf. hánnia. ánniayi und; that’s enough/ that’s all there is.
annííhk: before; annííhk otsíto’toohpi annííska oksísstsisska before, when her mother came here; annííhk isskóóhtsi from before.
anniim: the late … (minor third person); see annaam.
anno: this, proximity to the speaker and proximity or familiarity to the addressee; anno(i)stsi these.
annohk: now; ki ánnohk, máátsikakaisstoyiimio’pa and now, we are not even getting any cold weather.
ever; máátánowaitapoohpa I never went there; dialect var. óno ?
anootapisttsomo’kaan: cap/visored helmet; anootapisttsómo’kaanistsi caps; cf. isttsomo’kaan.
áóhkanohkimaiksi: gang; iitsínssiiwa áóhkanohkimaiksi he joined a gang.
aohkiáána’kimaa’tsis: oil lamp (lit.: water lamp); aohkiáána’kimaa’tsiistsi oil lamps; nitaohkiáána’kimaa’tsisi my oil lamp; cf. ana’kimaa’tsis.
aohkíí: water; sikáóhkiistsi vanilla (containers of) (lit.: black waters); nitáóhkiimi my water; see mííniaohkii berry water/ wine; see náápiaohkii ‘whiteman’s’ water/ whiskey.
áókiniimo: red cedar, Latin: Thuja plicata (Taylor); cf. kinii; Note: gender uncertain.
aohkiókiinimaa: avocet, Latin: Recurvirostra americana; aohkiókiinimaiksi avocets; cf. aohkii+okiin. aohkiómahkohsiiksikapaanssi  nan; tern, Latin: Sterna hirundo; aohkiomahkohsiiksikapaanssiiksi terns; cf. aohkii+omahk+siiksikapaanssi.
áóhkominoko: pea; áóhkominokoistsi peas; cf. kominoko. áóhko’kakinápikssi nan; bronco.
áóhpattsóótsiiyiiksi: bumper cars; cf. ohpattsii. áóhpiikiinaattsi nin; corn; áóhpiikiinaattsiistsi corn (pl.); cf. mohpííkin+inaattsi.
áóhpommaapiikoan: Caucasian merchant; áóhpommaapiikoaiksi Caucasian merchants; cf. ohpommaa+naapiikoan.
áóhpommáópii: storekeeper, merchant; áóhpommaopiiksi storekeepers; cf. ohpommaa+opii.
áóhpo’kiaa’paissi: cohort, companion; cf. ohpo’kiaa’paissi. áóhtako nin; waterfall/noisy thing; cf. ohtako.
áóhtoksóo’ki: yarrow, Latin: Achillea millefolium; áóhtoksóo’kiiksi yarrows.
áókakihtsimaa: judge, person in government, leader (lit.: one who makes decisions); áókakihtsimaiksi persons in government; cf. okakihtsimaa.
áókakihtsimaisiiko’taki: tax-collector; cf. okakihtsimaa+siiko’taki. áókaki’tsi nan; lookout, scout, one who watches, esp. for danger or opportunity. Could be used to refer to a modern day counsellor; áókaki’tsiiksi scouts; cf. okaki’tsi.
áókooysskaa: house-builder/carpenter/ contractor; áókooysskaiksi house- builders; cf. ookoowa+hkaa.
áókspiiyipisátssaisski: cone flower, Latin: Ratibida columnifera (Taylor); cf. okspii+pisatssaisski; Note: gender uncertain.
áókspipoko: sticky root (lit.: tastes sticky), Latin: Pachylobus caespitosus; cf. okspii+ipoko.
aoówahsin: food; aoówahsiistsi food; nitsówahsini my food; cf. oowat. aoó’ssin nin; berry soup/ dessert soup; aoó’ssiistsi dessert soups; pákkiaoó’ssin chokecherry soup; cf. waoo’si. áómatskahtaki nan; merchant, storekeepr; cf. omatskahtaki.
áópakíítsskii’p: chocolate; áópakiitsskii’pistsi chocolates; dialect var. aopakiipsskii’p.
áótahkááokayis: robin (lit.: yellow breast), Latin: Turdus migratorius; aotahkááokayiiksi robins; nitotahkááokayiima my robin; cf. otahko+maokayis.
áótahkóínaamm: orange (the fruit [Blood dialect]) (lit.: orange/ yellow in appearance); pokáótahkóínaammiksi little oranges; dialect var. aotahkoinaattsi (nin in Piikáni dialect).
aotokiaaki: make a hole in ice; áótókiaakit make a hole in the ice!; nítaotokiaaki I made a hole in the ice.
áótooksiinaattsi: bean; áótooksiinaattsiistsi beans; cf. motookis+inaattsi. áótotsóóki nan; the devil (lit.: the one who throws us in the fire); cf. ototoo. áótsikihtatoo’p nan/nin; cereal (lit.: what one soaks); cf. otsikihtatoo; Note: gender uncertain.
áóttaki: bartender (lit.: one who serves drinks); áóttakiiksi bartenders; cf. ottaki.
ao’ka’: chest; nitsiksísttsao’ka’yi I have chest pain.
ao’tamáak: just about to / imminent; nitáó’tamáaki’taki I’m about to get angry; cf. a’+otam+áak.
áó’tokiaakssin: man-made hole in the ice; áó’tokiaakssiistsi holes in ice; cf. o’takiaaki.
ao’tópistaan: cradleboard; ao’tópistaanistsi cradleboards; cf. o’tapist. áó’tsohkssistta’p nin; pill; áó’tsohkssistta’pistsi pills.
apahsípoko: alum root, Latin: Heuchera parvifolia; apahsípokoiksi alum roots; dialect var. aipahsipoko; cf. ipahs+ipoko; Note: Taylor: nin.
apahsónnikis: curdled milk, cottage cheese; cf. ipahs+onnikis. apahtók nan; general term for a coniferous evergreen tree; apahtókiksi conifers; nopahtóka my conifer.
apahtóksaapiooyis: pine log house; apahtóksaapiooyiistsi pine-log houses; cf. náápiooyis.
apahtóksipisskan: Saint Mary’s River; cf. apahtók+pisskan. apahtó’kii nan; lodgepole pine, Latin: Pinus contorta (Taylor). apáíhpiisoká’sim nin; skirt (lit.: waist clothing); ksíkkopáíhpiisoká’siistsi white skirts; nitopáíhpiisoká’simi my skirt; cf. opaihp+asoka’sim. apak adt; wide and flat; apáksski wide face; ik+ópaksikaawa he has wide feet; ikópakiiwa anníí moohsokóyi that road is wide; see apaksísttohkáksaakin adze.
apáksa’tsis: club, consisting of a round rock tied to a short handle, used as a weapon; nipáksa’tsiiksi my clubs; ómahkópaksa’tsisa big club; cf. ipak. apaksípistaan nin; pole used by leader of the Horn Society; apaksípistaanistsi poles used by leaders of the Horn Society; dialect var. apiksípistaan. apaksísttohkáksaakin nan; scraping tool, adze; apaksísttohkáksaakiiksi scraping tools, adzes; cf. apak+isttohk+kaksaakin. apaksísttohkihkíníítsitapiikoan nan; member of the Flathead Indian tribe; Apaksísttohkihkíníítsitapiikoaiksi members of the Flathead Indian tribe; cf. apak+isttohk+ihkin+niitsitapiikoan. apaksisttohkii vii; be flat; see opaksisttohkii. apaksísttohksíksaapiooyis nin; house made of lumber; apaksísttohksiksáápiooyiistsi houses made of lumber; cf. naapiooyis. apaksísttohksiksis nin; lumber, board; apaksísttohksiksiistsi boards; cf.apak+isttohk+iksis. apaksísttohksipokáí’staan  nan; men’s leggings; apaksísttohksipokáí’staaniksi men’s leggings.
apaksskióómii: pike (fish), Latin: Esox lucius; apaksskióómiiksi pikes; cf. apak+sski+mamii.
apánii: butterfly/ moth; apániiksi butterflies; sikopániiwa black butterfly.
apáni’kahtaa’tsis: tipi lining/curtain; (a)páni’kahtaa’tsiistsi tipi linings; cf. ipani’kahtaa+a’tsis.
apaohponotssim: belt worn on the outside of a breechcloth (archaic); otopáóhponotssimistsi belts.
ápasstaamiinaamm: apple; pokápasstaamiinaammiksi small apples; dialect var. áípaisstaamiinaattsi (Piikani dialect).
apasstaan: bridge; apásstaanistsi bridges; nopasstaani my bridge; dialect var. apaisstaan.
apa’p: emphatic; tsá kanistápa’paiksimsstaahpa? What ever were you thinking?
apiksípistaan: pole used by leader of the Horn Society; see apaksipistaan. apii vii; be; tsá anistápiiwa? what is it?; Rel. stem: vai apssi be; Note: adt required.
apinn: manipulate/adjust a strand-like object; isttapínnisa! weave the strand!; áako’tapinniiwa anni a’písi she will adjust the rope here; iyíístapapinniiwáyi he adjusted the strand out and away from it; nítssaapinnawa I adjusted the strand out from the inside of it; Note: adt req.
apisaan: pot of meat boiled over an open fire; otópisaanistsi his meat which was boiled over an open fire; cf. opisaa.
apisi: be legged; innápisiwa he’s long-legged; óta’si saahkápisiyináyi his horse has short legs; Note: adt req.
apitsó’toyi: killdeer (lit.: removes (something) from the water), Latin: Oxyechus vociferus; ápitso’toyiiksi killdeers; cf. opitso’tsi. apokaa nan; child; var. of pookaa.
apoká’siisi: roll-over; áakapoka’siisiwa áíksistomatomaahka’siwa the car will roll over.
apootstsiinaan: muscle; ápootstsiinaaniksi muscles; nitápotstsiinaani my muscle.
apoyi: brown (or any earth tone); apoyáakiiwa be a (relatively) fair-haired/ light-skinned female; ikápoyiihkiniwa she has (relatively) light colored hair.
apoyíínaattsi: be brown/ earth toned; áakapoyíínaattsiwa it will be brown; aapoyíínaattsiwa it is/was brown; Rel. stem: vai apoyíínaa be brown.
apssi: be; Rel. stem: apsii be; Note: adt req.
apssí: white buffalo berry (of the misisáími’so bush) (snowberry?)/ fig; dialect var. kapssí.
asáápo’pinááttsi: round-fruited anemone, a.k.a. wind flower, Latin: Anemone globosa; cf. saapo’p.
asáóhkama’tsis: container used when picking berries; kisáóhkama’tsiiksi your berry containers; Note: nin if describing a bag rather than a pail.
asinaa: Cree tribe; (a)sináíkoaiksi Cree persons; áísináí’poyiwa he speaks Cree; dialect var. assinaa; Note: Evidently, this term was formerly applied to Assiniboine - cf. pinaapisinaa.
asóka’sim: clothing, usually a jacket or overcoat; asóka’siistsi clothes; nisóka’simi my jacket.
asonnopa’tsis: quiver for arrows; cf. onnopa’tsis. asóópa’tsis nin; chair; var. of soopa’tsis.
asóótokiaa: fool, crazy one; var. of sootokiaa. asoyááhkoinnimaan nin; pouch for a pipe or tobacco; asoyááhkoinnimaanistsi pipe pouches; nisoyááhkoinnimaani my pipe pouch; cf. aso+yaahkoinnimaa.
asoyínn: barrel; ómahksísoyinnistsi big barrels; nisoyínni my barrel.
asoyínnáápiooyis: grainery (lit.: barrel house); asoyínnáápiooyiistsi graineries; nitsisoyínnáápiooyisi my grainery; Asoyínnáápiooyisi Claresholm, town of; cf. asoyinn+naapioyis.
ássa: Hey!, an expression used to get another’s attention, as in ‘look here!’ or ‘this is the way it is done and give that (what you have in your hand) to me’; dialect var. áhsa.
assaak: stop and VERB for a moment; ássáakippópiita! stop and sit for a moment!; ássáaksisstsiiwookit! stop and listen to me for a moment!; ássáaksika’yáakáó’piita! stop and sit just for a moment; Note: only in affirmative imperatives(?).
astotoohsin: clothing; var. of istotoohsin. at fin; var. of aat.
ataksáakiimi: have a box; kitáakataksáakiimi you will have a box.
atapíím: doll; atapíímiksi dolls; nits+ítapiima/nitátapiima my doll. atohká’taan nan; messenger, scout; atohká’taaniksi messengers, scouts. atokís nan; skin/hide; var. of mootokís.
atonáán: quillwork; atonáánistsi quillwork pieces; cf. otonaa. atonáóksis nan; needle; atonáóksiiksi needles; nitotonaoksiima my needle. atotáán nin; utility fire; cf. ototaa.
atowáa’tsis: cane; atowáa’tsiistsi canes; nitótowaa’tsisi my cane; cf. otowaanisoo.
ató’ahsim: sock; ató’ahsiiksi socks; nóóto’ahsima my sock.
atsíína: Gros Ventre tribe; Atsíínaikoaiksi members of the Gros Ventre tribe.
atsíínaimo: Meadow Rue (lit.: Gros Ventre scent), Latin: Thalictrum occidentale; atsíínaimoistsi Meadow Rues; cf. atsíína+imo.
atsíínaisisttsi: bobolink (lit.: Gros ventre bird), Latin: Dolichonyx oryzivorus; atsíínaisisttsiiksi bobolinks; cf. atsíína+sisttsí.
atsikín: footwear, shoe; natsikíístsi my shoes; i’nákitsikini little shoe; isstó+ítsiki+istsi winter shoes; niitsítsikini moccasin (lit.: original footwear).
atsinayí: fat; atsinayíístsi fats; ákaotsinayiyi old fat.
atsinikíísinaakssin: newspaper; (a)tsinikíísinaakssiistsi newpapers; nitsitsinikíísinaakssini my newspaper; cf. itsiniki+sinaaki. atsiníkssin nin; story; atsiníkssiistsi stories; cf. itsiniki.
átsi’tsi: mitten, glove; nótsi’tsiiksi my mittens; nínaotsi’tsiiksi men’s gloves.
atsí’tsi: pygmy owl, Latin: Glaucidium gnoma; atsí’tsiiksi pygmy owls; nínaatsi’tsiw male pygmy owl.
atsówa’ssko: bushy area, forest; atsówa’sskoistsi bushy areas; cf. ssko. atso’t adt; from all sides/ from more than one direction; átso’taapiksistakiyaawa they all threw their (e.g. money) together; áakatso’tsspommoawa we will all help him; atsó’toawa shot at from more than one direction.
attsi: causative; nitá’po’takiáttsaawa I caused her to work; nítsoyáttsaawa I caused her to eat/ I fed her; Note: forms vta; Rel. stem: vti attstoo cause. awaahkaniaaki nan; tailor; áwaahkániaakiiksi tailors; cf. waahkaniaaki. áwaamisskapataa nan; zipper (lit.: that which is pulled up); áwaamisskapataiksi zippers; cf. waamis+sskapat. áwaanataapistsisskitsi nin; evening primrose, Latin: Oenothera caespitosa (Taylor); cf. waanat+aapistsisskitsi.
áwaawai’sskapi: crawler/caterpillar; cf. waawai’s+skapi. awahkáa’tsis nin; toy; otáwahkaa’tsiistsi his toys; cf. waawahkaa+a’tsis.
áwahkahtaan: sweetheart of a male; nitáwahkahtaaniksi my sweethearts (male speaker).
awahkáóótsiiyssin: war; matóómomahkawahkaootsiiyssini World War I; cf. waawahkaootsiiyi.
awahsin: land, habitat, territory; nitáwahsiistsi my lands; kitáwahsinnooni our territory.
awáí’sstaakssin: cross; dialect var. awóí’sstaakssin; cf. awa’+sstaaki.
awakáapikssa’tsis: spur; awakáapikssa’tsiiksi spurs; nitáwakáapikssa’tsis my spur; dialect var. awaikaapikssa’tsis; cf. waawakaapikssat.
áwákaasiiki’somm: September (lit.: deer moon); Áwákaasiiki’sommiksi Septembers; cf. ki’somm.
áwákaasiistotoohsin: buckskin clothing; nitáwákaasiistotoohsiistsi my buckskin clothes; cf. istotoohsin.
awáksipistaan: otter fur wrapped pole, staff; nitawáksipistaanistsi my otter fur wrapped poles; cf. waaksipistaa.
awámma’tsis: baby toy; kitáwamma’tsiiksi your toys; cf. waawammaa. awanáán nan; rattle; awanáíksi/awanáániksi rattles; nitáwanáána my rattle. awápahkiaana’kimaa’tsis nin; light bulb/ propane lantern; nitáwapahkiaana’kimaa’tsiistsi my light bulbs; cf. owapahkis+aana’kimaa’tsis.
awápistaan: cradle swing, usually used for infants; awápistaanistsi cradle swings; nitáwapistaani my cradle-swing; cf. waawapistaa.
áwatoyi: white-tailed deer, Latin: Odocoileus virginianus; ómahkáwatoyiiksi big white-tailed deer.
awatsimaan: burrow, hole in the ground (e.g. gopher’s entrance); awátsimaanistsi holes in the ground; anna ómahkokatawa owátsimaani the gopher’s entrance.
áwatt: on one’s own initiative; áwatta’pistotoyiwa annííksi áínaka’siiksi he repaired/built the wagon himself.
awayiisoonii’p: full length headdress; nitayiisoonii’pistsi my full length headdresses; syn. ayiisoyiisaam.
awa’: crossed; awáí’naamaahkaawa he acquired crossed guns.
awó’taan: shield; pokawó’taanistsi little shields; nitáwo’taani my shield.
awó’taanookitsis: nail of the toe or finger; awó’taanookitsiiksi toes/ fingernails; nitáwo’taanookitsisa my fingernail; cf. awo’taan+mookitsis. ayaahkioohsiitapi nan; Assiniboine person (lit.: boatman, canoeist); áyaahkioohsiitapiiksi Assiniboine persons; cf. yaahkioohsi+matapi. ayaak adt; imminent future/ about to; áyaaksoyiwa he’s just about starting to eat.
ayaam: wrong, different direction/ misdirected; áyaamoowa he went in a different direction; áakayaamiistsiwa it will be carried away (by the current); iyáámsstsitsikiwa he had his shoes on in the wrong way.
ayaamoyi’poyi: joke/ jest from a misdirected mouth (so as to be disguised from the inhabitants of a Sundance encampment); ayáámoyí’poyit! jest!; áakayaamoyí’poyiwa he will joke; iiyáámoyí’poyiwa he joked; nitáyaamoyí’poyi I joked; cf. ayaam; Rel. stem: vta ayaamoyi’powat joke to (the inhabitants of a Sundance).
ayaoo: similar to English expressions ‘oh no!’, ‘oops!’; dialect var. yáa. áyiinapanii nan; reporter; cf. yiinapanii.
ayíkinaan: paranormal force which can be communicated with; nitáyikinaaniksi paranormal forces with whom I communicate; otáyikinaani the paranormal force with whom he communicates.
áyinnimaa: hawk (lit.: seizer); áyinnimaiksi hawks; cf. yinn.
á’: inchoative (denotes the beginning of a state or recent completion of an event/ fulfillment of an expectation; áí’to’toowa iihkitsíkaayi it is now seven o’clock; áó’mai’takiwa now she’s convinced (cf. omai’taki).
a’kahkaakii: flying ant/ gnat; poká’kahkaakiiksi small flying ants.
a’kakáwaatsimaan: hole in the side of a cliff or embankment.
a’kahkó: curved/inclined geographical feature, e.g. a bend in a river, hill; a’kahkóístsi curved geographical features; a’kahkóóhtsi on an incline; dialect var. aakahkó.
a’kihtákssin: cairn/ stones as a marker or memorial; a’kihtákssiistsi cairns; cf. wa’kihtaki.
a’kíítoyi: quaking aspen, Latin: Populus tremuloides (Taylor); a’kíítoyiistsi aspens.
wa’kikaihtsii: lie on one’s back; a’kikáíhtsiit lie on your back!; Rel. stems: vta wa’kikaihtsi, vti wa’kikaohtoo lay on his back, lay on its back. a’kióóhsin nin; stamp or logo; nitá’kioohsiistsi my stamps or logos; cf. wa’ki. a’kooht adt; at a distance; a’kóóhtamao’ka he is there at a distance; a’kóóhtska ááhkomaohta’pawááwahkaawa he is probably still travelling in distant (places).
a’ksikahkssin: arch of the sole of the foot; nitá’tsiksikahkssiistsi my arches.
á’p: about, around; á’pawááwahkaawa she is walking about; kitá’paissammoka he is looking around for you; áaká’paitsinikiwa she will go about telling stories.
a’painahkimaa: look around for a girlfriend; á’páínahkimaat! look for a girlfriend!; áaka’painahkimaawa he will …; a’páínahkimaawa he looked/ is looking for a girlfriend; nitá’painahkimaa I looked/ am looking for a girlfriend.
a’paisii: it pass (said of time); áaka’paisiiwa time will pass; a’páísiiwa time passed; stáma’paisiiwa and time passed.
a’paissi: be at a location/ spend time; istá’paissit! spend some time here!; nitáísokita’paissi I used to spend time there; iyíístapita’paissiwa he’s around elsewhere; annóóm itá’paissiyaawa they are around here; tsimáa kitsitá’paisspa? where were you?; Note: adt required.
a’paisskin: touch/manipulate the face of; a’paisskinisa! touch her face!; áaka’paisskiniiwa you will touch her face; á’paisskiniiwáyi he touched her whole face; nitá’paisskinoka she is manipulating my face; cf. sski.
á’pai’piksi: arrange; a’páí’piksit! re-arrange it!; áaká’pai’piksima she will arrange it; a’páí’piksima anni sóópa’tsisi he arranged the chair; nitá’pai’piksii’pa I arranged it; á’pawai’piksima anniistsi sóópa’tsiistsi he is arranging the chairs.
a’pami: be; ááhksikkama’pamiwa it might be him; cf. ami. a’panii vai; be critical (of s.o. or s.t.); á’pawaaniiwa he is critical; cf. a’p+waanii; Rel. stems: vta a’panist, vti a’panistoo criticize.
á’páóoyi’kaa: look (around) for food; a’páóoyi’kaat! look for food!; áaka’páóoyi’kaawa he will …; á’páóoyi’kaawa he looked/is looking for food; nitá’páóoyi’kaa I looked/ am looking for food.
a’patapiksist: throw around, wrestle/ euphemism for rape; a’patápiksistsisa! throw him around!; áaka’patapiksistsiiwáyi he will rape her; á’patápiksistsiiwáyi he raped her; nitá’patápiksikka he raped me; a’pawaatapiksistsiiwáyi he is throwing him around.
a’pihka: give away/ sell; a’pihkáísa, anna kóta’sa! sell your horse!; áaka’pihkaiiwáyi she will sell it; á’pihkaiiwa osí’kaani he gave away his blanket; nitá’pihkaoka she gave me away; ákaa’páíhkaiiwa óta’si he has sold his horse.
a’pihkahtoo: give away/ sell; á’pihkahtóót! give it away!; áaka’pihkahtooma she will give it away; á’pihkahtooma he gave it away; nitá’pihkahtoo’pa I gave it away; ákaa’paihkahtooma kisóka’simi he has sold your jacket; Rel. stem: vai a’pihkahtaki sell/give away/trade (s.t.).
a’pii: be in a specified way; áakonakia’piiwa it will be appealing; ííkssoka’piiwa it is very good; Note: adt req; Rel. stem: vai a’pssi be in a specified way.
a’piksikka’yi: walk; á’piksíkka’yit! walk!; áaka’piksikka’yiwa she’ll walk; a’piksíkka’yiwa she walked; nitá’piksíkka’yi I walked; á’paiksikka’yiwa he is walking around.
a’pís: rope; a’pííksi ropes; nitó’piima my rope.
á’pistotaki: build/make (something); a’pistotakit! make (s.t.)!; nitá’pistotaki I made (something); á’paistotakiwa niitá’paisiksikimii she is making coffee; Rel. stems: vti a’pistotsi, vta a’pistoto make.
á’pistoto: build/make; Rel. stem: vti a’pistotsi build/make.
á’pistotooki: God, Creator, our Maker (lit.: the one who made us); cf. a’pistoto.
a’písttaapiksistaki: snack, move about tasting food (Blood dialect); a’písttaapiksistakit! snack!; áaka’písttaapiksistakiwa she will snack; a’písttaapiksistakiwa he snacked; nitá’písttaapiksistaki I snacked; á’páísttaapiksistakiwa he is snacking; syn. á’páísttapomao’si.
a’písttaapikssi: dodge around; á’písttaapikssit! dodge around!; áaka’písttaapikssiwa she will …; a’písttaapikssiwa he dodged; nitá’písttaapikssi I dodged; á’páísttaapikssiwa he is dodging around.
a’písttotsi: be semi-nomadic, move around looking for a place to camp; a’písttotsit! be semi-nomadic!; áaka’písttotsiwa she will …; a’písttotsiwa he moved around looking for a place to camp; nitá’písttotsi I looked around for a place to camp.
á’pitsííhtaa: worry (about s.t.); á’pitsííhtaat! worry!; áaka’pitsiihtaawa she will worry; á’pitsííhtaawa he worried; nitá’pitsííhtaa I worried; nitá’páítsiihtaa I am worrying; Rel stems: vti a’pitsiihtatoo, vta a’pitsiihtat worry about.
á’pohpáttsii: jar, jolt by colliding with; piiná’pohpattsiit anní kitsskíítaani! don’t jar your baking!; áaká’pohpáttsiima she will jolt it; á’pohpáttsiima he jolted it; nitá’pohpáttsii’pa I jolted it; nitá’paohpáttsii’pa I am jarring it; cf. ohpáttsii.
á’pohpáttsski: cause displacement by jarring or bumping; á’pohpáttsskit! jar it out of place!; áaka’pohpáttsskima she will bump it out of place; á’pohpáttsskima he jarred it out of place; nitá’pohpáttsskii’pa I bumped it out of place; máátakohkottá’pohpáttskimaatssiksi he can’t budge it; Rel. stem: vta a’pohpáttssko move by bumping / cause to stumble.
á’pohpá’wani: move around/ toss oneself around / jump; á’pohpá’wanit! move!; isskskámmisa, áaka’pohpá’waniwa watch over him, he will move; amo nítáakohko’sa isstóna’pohpá’waniwa my baby jumped hard (inside me); nitá’pohpa’wani I moved; áyo’kaawa ki mátta’paohpá’waniwa he is sleeping and still he is tossing and turning.
á’poo: travel/ move about; á’póót! travel!; áaka’póówa she will travel; á’póówa she travelled; nitá’poo I travelled; cf. oo. a’póóhsin nin; journey, trip; a’póóhsiistsi journeys, trips.
á’po’taki: work, be operational, be in effect; á’pó’takit work!; áaka’po’takiwa annííhka kóminokoyi the pill is in effect; á’po’takiwa he worked; nitá’po’taki I worked; á’páó’takiwa he works; Rel. stems: vta a’po’to, vti á’po’tsi work on.
á’pssapópii: ride around (in a vehicle); á’pssapópiit! ride around!; áaka’pssapópiiwa she’ll ride around; á’pssapópiiwa she rode around; nitá’pssapópii I rode around; á’páísapópiiwa he is riding around.
a’pssi: be in a specified way; see wattsa’pssi be crazy; see ihtawa’pssi lucky; iikóka’pssiwa he is bad; see ikohkia’pssi be embarrassed; Note: adt req; Rel. stem: vii a’pii be in a specified way.
a’psski: seek, look into, try to discover (lit.: chase after); a’psskít! look into it / seek it!; áaka’psskima she will seek it; á’psskima he sought after it; nitá’psskii’pa I sought after it; á’paisskima máakoohkohkóókooyissi he is trying to find a way to get a house; Rel. stems: vta a’pssko, vai a’psskaki chase.
á’psskiáapikssat: make a face at; á’psskiáapikssatsisa! make a face at her!; áaka’psskiáapikssatsiiwáyi she will make a face at him; á’psskiáapikssatsiiwáyi she made a face at him; nitá’psskiáapikssakka she made a face at me; nitá’paisskiáapikssatawáyi I am making faces at her; Rel. stem: vai a’psskiáapikssi make a face.
a’pssko: chase; á’psskóósa! chase her!; áaka’psskoyiiwáyi he will chase him; á’psskoyiiwáyi he chased her; nitá’psskooka she chased me; á’paisskoyiiwáyi he is chasing her around.
á’psskootsiiyi: play (lit.: chase one another around); á’p(áí)sskóótsiiyik! play!; áaka’psskootsiiyiyaawa they will play; á’psskootsiiyiyaawa they were playing; nitá’psskootsiiyihpinnaana we were playing; á’páísskootsiiyiyaawa they are chasing each other around; cf. a’pssko; Note: plural subject req.
a’pssto: beckon (summon or signal with a wave)/ make hand signs to; a’psstóósa! beckon to her!; áaka’psstoawa we (incl. you) will beckon to her; á’psstoyiiwáyi he beckoned to her; nitá’psstooka she beckoned to me; nitá’paisstoawa I am waving at her; Rel. stem: vai a’psstaki wave/ make hand signs.
a’s: young; var. of wa’s. a’s nan; non-init. var. of ma’s.
a’sáán: paint for face and tipi; a’sáánistsi paints (eg. of different colors); nits+í’saani my paint; máóhksí’saani/ máóhkí’saani (North Piikani dialect) red paint.
a’si: mediopassive; ákáóoya’siwa it has been eaten; áwaaniya’siwa it’s been said (foretold); Note: forms vii.
a’síítahtaa: brook, (lit.: young river); poká’síítahtaistsi brooks; cf. wa’s+niítahtaa.
a’síítsiksáápiooyis: poplar log house; á’síítsiksáápiooyiistsi poplar log houses; poká’síítsiksáápiooyisi small poplar log house; cf. naapiooyis.
a’síítsiksimm: poplar tree (Taylor: cottonwood tree), Latin: Populus trichocarpa; a’síítsiksimmiksi poplar trees; poká’síítsiksimmi small poplar tree.
a’sííya’tsis: medicinal sneezing plant (plant is yellow in color), false hellebore, Latin: Veratrum hellebore; a’sííya’tsiistsi medicinal sneezing plants; see also iihtawa’siiyo’p; cf. wa’siiyi+a’tsis.
a’simi: be young (said of horses); áaka’simiwa she will be young; ama nóta’sa á’simiwa my horse is young; mááta’simiwa he is not young; cf. wa’s.
a’sínnoka: caribou (lit.: young elk), Latin: Rangifer tarandus; a’sínnokaiksi caribou (plural); cf. wa’s+ponoka.
a’sipís: thread, sinew used for sewing; a’sipííksi threads; nits+í’sipiima my thread.
a’sisttsííksiinaa: young snake; a’sisttsííksiinaiksi young snakes; nitá’sisttsííksiinaima my young snake; cf. wa’s+pitsiiksiinaa. a’sitápi nan; young person; cf. wa’s+matapi.
a’tsis: tool/ associated instrument; see sisóya’tsis scissors; (a)páksa’tsisa small axe, hatchet (lit.: hitting tool); see issitsimaa’tsis baby thing.
hánnia: expression used in response to a topic of interest, (really!, is that right!); cf. ann.
ha’: expression used to show scorn for someone’s showy/exhibitionistic behavior.
há’ayaa: expression used mainly by males in anticipation of a reprimand / oh-oh!
hkaa: acquire; matóómiihkaat! go fishing! (lit.: go acquire fish!); anna pookááwa iihpokónsskaawa the child got a ball; nita’painaansskaa I am going about acquiring gifts; nitsíítsikiihkaa I got shoes; Note: attaches to nouns, forms vai.
hko: provide to; nitohpokónsskoawa nohkówa I got a ball for my son; Note: attaches to nouns, forms vta.
hsin: nominalizer on vai; aoówahsini food; ninihkssíístsi songs; Note: see Grammar, chapter 20.
hskin: back; see ipaksskini hit on the back; nitáísttsoohtsátsiksskini I have a back ache; nitáótohskíniaaki I bend my back.
ihkahtoo: pass by hand in a specified direction; iihtóíhkahtooma he passed it around; áaksikimihkahtooma she will pass it to the front; Note: adt req. ihka’si fin; behave in a specified manner; miináttoka’pipokaihka’sit! don’t act like a bad child!; áakssokihka’siwa she will act good; isttsíístomiihka’siwa he acted sick; see aisspihka’si act snobbish; see okihka’si misbehave; see waakiihka’siwa he acts like a woman (is effeminate); Note: adt or nan req., forms vai;
ihkiitaa: bake, cook (by heat); kíítaat! bake!; áakihkiitaawa he will …; iihkíítaawa he baked; nítsskiitaa I baked (s.t.); Rel. stems: vta ihkiitat, vti ihkiitatoo bake.
ihkin: head/hair; iikómahkihkiniwa he has a big head; máóhkihkiniwa he has red hair; sskánatsskiniwa she has nice hair; see isttsikihkini be bald.
ihkit: freeze; iihkitsíkawa he froze his feet/foot; Rel. stem: ihkítsstookiwa he froze his ear(s).
ihkitsi: dry; áakihkitsiwa it will dry; iihkítsiwa it dried; ákaihkitsiwa kaapoksíínimaani the floor is dry; Rel. stem: vai ihkssoyi dry.
ihkihsi: dry; nítsskssíí’pa I dried it; Rel. stem: vta ihkihs dry. ihkitsik adt; seven; see ohkitsikamm be seven. ihkitsíkammiksi nan; the big dipper (lit.: the seven (stars)). ihksi vrt; be stiff/numb.
ihksika: have a stiff leg; kitáaksikihksika/kitáaksikssksika you will have a very stiff leg; nitsííkihksika I have a very stiff leg.
ihkssaki: dry (something); ihkssakít! dry (s.t.)!; áakihkssakiwa í’ksisakoi she will dry meat; dialect var. ihkihsaki; Rel. stems: vta ihkss, vti ihkssi dry.
ihkssoyi: become dry; áakihkssoyiwa it will dry; iihkssóyiwa it dried; annííksi katsííksi máátomaihkssoyíwaiksaawa your pants, they are not dry yet.
ihpiyi: dance; ihpiyít! dance!; nitáakihpiyi I will …; ihpíyiwa he danced; nítsspiyi I danced; nitáíhpiyi I am dancing; ihpíy’ssini dance (noun); Rel. stem: vti ihpiwatoo dance (a dance).
ihtaki: place (s.t.); áaksimiihtakiwa she will make a mess/ place her things in disarray; iiyáakihtakiwa he packed; nitsítsoohkihtaki ataksáakssini I placed a box by the door; Note: adt req; Rel. stems: vti ohtoo, vta ihtsi place.
ihtakssin: belongings; otsstákssiistsi his belongings; otsimííhtakssini her belongings which make a mess; cf. ihtaki.
ihtatsiki: middle, center, midst; tátsikikkónamaana Sundance center pole; áakomatapsstatsikiáíksistsikowa it will start being midday; see ihtatsikiooyi eat mid-day meal; itáíhtatsikiipoyiwa he stands in the middle.
ihtatsikiooyi: eat mid-day meal (lunch); ihtátsikióoyit! eat lunch!; áakihtátsikióoyiwa she will …; iihtátsikióoyiwa he ate lunch; nítsstatsikióoyi I ate lunch; cf. ooyi.
ihtawa’pssi: be lucky; ihtawá’pssit! be lucky!; áakihtawa’pssiwa she will …; iihtawá’pssiwa he was lucky; nítsstawa’pssi I was lucky; Rel. stems: vti ihtawa’pssatoo, vta ihtawa’pssat have luck with.
fortuitous, lucky; iihtáwohkoonima luckily he found it; áakaihtawohkaaniiwa he will be witty (lit.: he will be lucky in that he finds something [the right thing] to say); ííhtayíssiniiwa she hit the target by a lucky aim; Note: y~w.
ihtohkihtsi: bed down, retire; iihtohkihtsít! bed down!/go to bed!; máaksáwootóíhtohkihtso’pa let’s go to bed; Rel. stem: vta ihtohkihtsi bed down (e.g. horse).
ihtsii: lie down; itáíhtsiiwa he’s lying there; ámoyi istsstsíít! lie here!; Rel. stem: vai ihtsi crawl; Note: adt req.
ihtsíípi: bring to town; ihtsíípiisa! bring her to town!; áakihtsíípiyiiwáyi she will bring him to town; iihtsíípiyiiwáyi he brought her to town; nítsstsíípiooka she brought me to town; Rel. stem: vti ihtsíípohtoo bring to town.
ihtsiiyi: have a sweat (use a sweatlodge); sstsííyit! have a sweat!; nitáakihtsiiyi I’ll have a sweat.
ihtsiiyimm: admire; ihtsííyimmisa! admire her!; áakihtsiiyimmiiwáyi she will admire him; iihtsííyimmiiwáyi she admired her; nítsstsííyimmoka she admired me; nitáíhtsiiyimmoka she admires me.
ihtsiiyi’tsi: admire, like; ihtsííyi’tsit! admire it (e.g. the chair)!; áakihtsiiyi’tsima omi náápiooyisi she will admire (the appearance of) that house; iihtsííyi’tsima he liked it (e.g. the name he was given); nítsstsiiyi’tsii’pa kisóka’sima I admired your dress; Rel. stem: vai ihtsiiyi’taki admire.
ihtsikssi: be sleepy; (ihtsíkssit!) (be sleepy!); áakihtsikssiwa she will be …; iihtsíkssiwa he is sleepy; nitáíhtsikssi I am sleepy; (ki)kátai’ihtsíksspa? Are you sleepy?; nítsstsikssi I’m sleepy; nitsíkihtsikssi I’m very sleepy.
ihtsisaoo: come out from a group or step forward; ihtsisaoot!/stsisáóot! step forward!; áaksstsisáóowa she will …; ííhtsisáóowa he came out from the group; nítsstsisáóo I came out from the group; iihtsisáóo’pa we (incl.) came out.
ihtsisoo: go to town or to a populated center; ihtsisóót! go to town!; áakihtsisoowa she will …; iihtsisóówa she went to town; nítsstsisoo I went to town; iihtsisáóo’pa we (incl.) went to town; dialect var. stsisoo.
ihtsisttaki: swallow (consume); ihtsísttakit! swallow!; áakihtsisttakiwa she will …; iihtsísttakiwa he swallowed; nítsstsisttaki I swallowed; Rel. stems: vti ihtsistta, vta ihtsisttam consume.
ihtsisttamaa: swallow/ consume the whole (of s.t.); ihtsísttamaat! consume (something)!; áakihtsisttamaawa she will …; ihtsísttamaawa he consumed (s.t.); nítsstsisttamaa I consumed (s.t.).
chase, pursue; isstsóóhkitsiyisa! chase him!; áaksstsóóhkitsiyiiwáyi she will chase him; iihtsóóhkitsiyiiwáyi he chased her; nítsstsoohkitsiwoka she chased me; nítsstsoohkitsiwawa I chased her; Note: y~w.
ihtsoohkitso: pursue, chase; ihtsóóhkitsoosa! chase him!; var. of ihtsoohkitsi. .
ihtssi: ignite; nitáíhtssii’pa I’m lighting it; var. of sstssi. ii fin; see niitsii true; Note: forms intransitive verb.
iihk: opportune; iihkáwa’kimaawa he had opportunity to chase; var of ohk. iihkanipihtsi nan; leader or organizer, e.g. of a raiding party or meeting; iihkanípihtsiiksi organizers.
iihkaohpokomsskaa: have the mumps; iihkáóhpokomsskaawa he has the mumps.
iihkawa: neighbor/associate/companion; otsííhkawayi his neighbor; nitsííhkawaiksi my associates; dialect var. iihkowa / iihkawaan. iihpáíksksisttsikaahkiaakio’p nin; starch (lit.: what one spreads stiffly with); iihpáíksksisttsíkaahkiaakio’pistsi starches, e.g. varieties of; cf. isttsikaahkiaaki.
iihpohsoa’tsii: American rough-legged hawk (lit.: with eagle tail-feathers), Latin: Buteo lagopus; iihpohsóa’tsiiksi American rough-legged hawks; cf. ohp+mohsooa’tsis.
iihpokaopiimotsiiyi: spouse; iihpokáópiimotsiiyiiksi spouses; cf. ohpokaopiim+otsiiyi; Note: plural required.
iihsiss: younger sibling of female; otómahkohsissi her big younger sibling (i.e. the older of her younger siblings); ohsíssiksi her younger siblings; nissíssa my younger sibling.
iiht: linker for source, instrument, means, path, or content; see oht. iihtáíhkitsoohpattsaakio’p nan; clothes dryer (Blood dialect); iihtáíhkitsoohpattsáakio’piksi clothes dryers; nómohtáíhkitsoohpattsáakihpa what I dry my clothes with; cf. ihkitsi. iihtáíkahksiststakio’p nan; saw; iihtaíkahksiststakio’piksi saws; cf. ikahksiststaki.
iihtáíkawai’piksistakio’p: key (lit.: what one opens with); iihtáíkawai’piksistakio’piksi keys; cf.  ikawai’piksi. iihtáíkayinnakio’p nan; can opener (lit.: what one opens by hand with); cf. ikayinni.
iihtáíkkamipii’poyo’p: telegraph (lit.: what one talks far and quickly with); iihtáíkkamípii’poyo’piksi telegraphs; cf. ikkam+ipi+i’poyi.
iihtáíkkiniihkimiksaakio’p: cultivator (lit.: what one softens the soil with); iihtáíkkiniihkimiksáakio’piksi cultivators; cf. ikkiniihkimmiksiiyi.
iihtáíkkio’p: wind instrument, e.g. trumpet, whistle; iihtáíkkio’piksi wind instruments; cf. ikki.
iihtáíkkowao’p: beak (lit.: what one pecks with); omohtáíkkowaahpoaawaistsi their beaks; cf. ikkawatoo iihtáíksisiststao’p nin; whetstone; ihtáíksisiststao’pistsi whetstones; cf. iksisistsim.
iihtáíksistsikomio’p: clock; iihtáíksistsikomio’piksi clocks; cf. iksistsiko. iihtáíksisttoksaakio’p nan; nail; iihtáíksisttoksáakio’piksi nails; cf. iksisttoksii.
iihtáípiinitakio’p: farm implement used to tear the ground into pieces, disc plough; iihtáípiinitakio’piksi disc ploughs; cf. ipiinitaki.
iihtáípii’poyo’p: telephone (lit.: what one talks afar with); iihtáípii’poyo’piksi telephones; dialect var. iihtai’poyo’p; cf. ipii+i’poyi. iihtáípiksao’p nan; hammer (lit.: what one hits with); iihtáípiksao’piksi hammers; cf. ipiksi.
iihtáíppotsipistao’p: hair fastener, e.g. ribbon, hide strips (lit.: what we braid with); iihtáíppotsipistao’piksi hair fasteners; cf. ippotsipistaa.
iihtáípsstomaahkao’p: gate/entrance; cf. iiht+ipsst+omaahkaa+o’p. iihtáísaipsskaahp nin; eye of needle; cf. saip+?
iihtáísaisi’toyihpi: chimney, stove vent; cf. iiht+saisi’toyi. iihtáísikkonnikipsso’p nin; brassiere, breast binder; iihtáísikkonnikipsso’pistsi bras; cf. sikk+monnikis.
iihtáísapiipommao’p: seed; cf. sapiipommaa. iihtáísatsínaakio’p nan; scraper; cf. satsínaaki. iihtáísattsíkaapiksistakio’p nan; bell; cf. sattsikaapiksistaki. iihtáísikksinipsso’p nin; girdle; iihtáísikksinipsso’pistsi girdles.
iihtáísínaakio’p: camera; iihtáísínaakio’piksi cameras; cf. sinaaki. iihtáísokamisáóo’p nin; step/ladder; iihtáísokamisaoo’pistsi steps/ladders; cf. sok+wamis+oo; syn. sokamisaaka’tsis.
iihtáísoksistawa’sao’p: vest; ksikkohtáísoksistawa’sao’pistsi white vests; nomohtáísoksistawa’sspi my vest; cf. sok+istawa’si.
iihtáíso’pioohso’p: scarf, veil, kerchief; iihtáíso’pioohso’piksi scarves, kerchiefs; nomohtáíso’pioohsspa my scarf; cf. iso’pioohsi.
iihtáíssáakio’p: dish towel, dish cloth; iihtáíssáakio’piksi dish towels/ cloths; cf. ssaaki.
iihtáíssiiststakio’p: washing machine; iihtáíssiiststakio’piksi washing machines; nomohtáíssiiststakihpa my washer; cf. ssiiststaki.
iihtáíssisskioohsao’p: bath/face towel (lit.: what is used to wipe one’s face); iihtáíssisskioohsao’piksi bath towels; cf. ssisskioohsi.
iihtáísskskaakio’p: ruler/measuring instrument; iihtáísskskaakio’pistsi rulers; cf. sskskaaki.
iihtáíssokááhkiaakio’p: scale (lit.: what we weigh with); iihtáíssokáahkiaakio’piksi scales; cf. ssokaahki.
iihtáísstssimao’p: branding iron or cigarette lighter (lit.: what we light/ burn with); ómahkohtáísstssimao’piksi big branding irons or big cigarette lighters; nómohtáísstssimaahpiksi my branding irons or cigarette lighters; cf. sstssimaa.
iihtáísttsikááhkiaakio’p: iron (lit.: what one smoothes with); iihtáísttsikááhkiaakio’piksi irons; cf. isttsikaahkiaaki. iihtáísttsikááhkimao’p nin; spread (e.g. butter); iihtáísttsikááhkimao’pistsi spreads; cf. isttsikaahkimaa.
iihtáítsiimooyao’p: false Solomon’s seal, Latin: Smilacena racemosa (Taylor); iihtáítsiimóoyao’pistsi false Solomon’s seals; cf. iiht+á+itsiiy+imo+oyi ?
iihtáítsinikio’p: telegraph (lit.: what one relates stories with); iihtáítsinikio’pistsi telegraphs; cf. itsiniki. iihtáí’tsinssakio’p nan; toaster; cf. i’tsinssaki.
iihtáóhkomatakio’p: driver’s license; ííhtaohkomatakio’pistsi driver’s licenses; cf. ohkomataki.
iihtáóhpakóyi’sakio’p: hollow bone used when doctoring with herbs; iihtáóhpakóyi’sakio’pistsi hollow bones used when doctoring; cf. ohpakoyi’s.
iihtáóhpommao’p: money; cf. ohpommaa. iihtáóhsistsiniimsstao’p nan; horseshoe; iihtaóhsistsiniimsstao’piksi horseshoes; cf. ohsistsiniimsstaa.
iihtáókoopsskao’p: soup base / cabbage (So. Piikani dialect); cf. okoopihkaa.
iihtáókspainnohkio’takio’p: crayon; cf. okspainnohkio’taki. iihtáókspainnakio’p nin; glue/tape/bandage; cf. okspainni. iihtáómaitsimihkio’p nin; wild buckwheat, Latin: Fragaria virginiana (Taylor); iihtáómaitsimihkio’pistsi buckwheat plants; cf. omaitsimihki. iihtáómatskapatakio’p nin; towing apparatus; iihtáómatsskapatakio’pistsi towing apparatuses; cf. omat+sskapat.
iihtáóoyo’p: fork (lit.: what one eats with); iihtáóoyo’piksi forks; cf. ooyi. iihtáópahkimiksáakio’p nan; plough, used in breaking up new ground; iihtáópahkimiksáakio’piksi ploughs; cf. opahkimiksáaki.
iihtáóttakio’p: ladle, dipper (for liquid) (lit.: what one dips drinks with); omahkohtáóttakio’piksi big dippers; cf. ottaki. iihtáó’takaahkiaakio’p nan; screwdriver or wrench (lit.: what one makes rotations with); iihtáó’takááhkiaakio’piksi screwdrivers; cf. o’tak. iihtáó’takio’p nan; tongs (lit.: what one takes with); iihtáó’takio’piksi tongs; cf. o’taki.
iihtawáákomímmotsiiyo’p: love medicine (lit.: what makes us love each other); iihtawáákomímmotsiiyo’pistsi love medicines; cf. waakomimm.
iihtawáámato’simao’p: ceremonial tongs for incense; dialect var. iihtowáámato’simao’p; cf. waamato’simaa. iihtawáí’tsinnakio’p nan; sewing machine/ Glover needle; iihtawáí’tsinnakio’piksi sewing machines; cf. wai’tsinnaki. iihtawáóniaakio’p nan; can opener, brad awl; iihtawáóniaakio’piksi can openers; cf. waonii.
iihtawá’siiyo’p: (lit.: what makes one sneeze), false hellebore, Latin: Veratrum viride (Taylor); syn. a’sííya’tsis; cf. wa’siiyi.
iihtáyaakohkimmao’p: steering wheel; iihtáyaakohkimmao’pistsi steering wheels; cf. yaakohkimmaa.
iihtáyiyaahkiaakio’p: screwdriver (lit.: what one tightens with); iihtáyiyaahkiaakio’piksi screwdrivers.
iihtáyo’kimao’p: breech-cloth (lit.: what one closes with); iihtáyo’kimao’pistsi breech-cloths; cf. yo’kimaa.
iihtá’paisskootsiiyo’p: game (lit.: means by which one plays); iihtá’paisskootsiiyo’pistsi games; cf. a’psskootsiiyi. iihtohtsstsi vai; behind, to the rear; iihtohtsstsíwa he’s behind me. iihtsíístapipaitapiiyo’p nan; ancestor; cf. yiistapipaitapiiyi
iihtsipáítapiiyo’pa: the creator, God (lit.: the one through whom we live); cf. ipaitapiiyi.
iihtsipóísstao’takio’p: fence post; cf. ipoistao’taki. iihtsistsíípisskio’p nan; fencing wire (lit.: what we make a fence with); iihtsistsíípisskio’piksi (fencing) wires; cf. yaaksistsiipisski. iihtsitok  adt; through; áakohtsitokoowa omííksi matápiiksi he will go through the crowd.
iik: intensifier, very; iikáísstóksoyiwa she eats very much; máátsikohtohkoiikio’pa it is not of very much use to us; áaksiksstoyiwa it will be very cold.
ííkaitaisttsinao’p: Wednesday (Piikani dialect) (lit.: when we have already drawn rations); Ííkaitaisttsinao’pistsi Wednesdays.
iikska’: exceptionally. extremely; ííkskai’sstoytiwa it’s extremely cold.
iimaa: yet/ to the present time; iimááyo’kaawa he’s sleeping yet; máát+omáá+yo’kááwaiksaawa they’re not sleeping yet; máátomaihtsisoowa he hasn’t gone to town yet; kátao’mainoawa? have you seen her yet?
iimáápitsi: monkey (Piikani) (lit.: imitator); iimáápitsiiksi monkeys; nitsiimáápitsiima my monkey; syn. maokii; cf. yiimaapitsi.
iimahkáyii: Trumpeter swan (lit.: large gull), Latin: Cygnus buccinator; iimahkáyiiksi swans.
íímahkihkinaa: sheep; pókomahkihkinaiksi small sheep; nitómahkihkínaama my sheep.
iimáóhkominniiksiini: red-winged blackbird (lit.: red-winged cowbird), Latin: Agelaius phoeniceus; iimáóhkominniiksííniiksi red-winged blackbirds.
iimáóhksiipssi: member of the Redbelt Society; Iimáóhksiipssiimiksi members of the Redbelt Society/ the Redbelt Society (as a whole).
iimapááhko: pack lunch for; iimapááhkoosa! pack him a lunch!; áaksiimapááhkoyiiwáyi she will pack him a lunch; iimapááhkoyiiwáyi he packed her a lunch; nitsíímapááhkooka he packed me a lunch; Note: archaic.
iimat: start to, almost/similar to; var. of omat.
iimatáípakkihkaa: grape (lit.: almost bursting); iimatáípakkihkaistsi grapes; cf. omat+a+ipakki.
iimatotsiinaimo: labrador tea, Latin: Ledum glandulosum? (Taylor); iimatótsíínaimoistsi labrador tea plants; cf. iimat+atsiina+imo. iimíkihta’tsskaan nin; weapon; iimíkihta’tsskaanistsi weapons; cf. imikihta’tsskaa.
iimitaohkatsi: wild strawberry/ fairy bell, Latin: Disporum trachycarpum (Taylor); iimitáóhkatsiistsi fairy bells; cf. imitaa+ohkat.
iin: VERB when should be doing something else; nitáí(i)nióoyi I am eating (when I should be working, for example); nitsi(i)ní’poyi I talked instead of what I should have been doing / I put in my opinion; miináttsitsini’poyit! don’t speak out of turn!
iinán: banana/marrow; iináístsi bananas; dialect var. iináán; Note: animate gender for some speakers.
iinao’k: however; iináó’kaniiwa however, he said …; kitsíínao’ksippitaipokaawa you, however, are an elder’s child.
iinatt: continue VERBing when should be doing something else; nitáíinattsooyi I am too busy eating (to pay attention, e.g.); cf. iin+matt. iinawátso vta; elect as chief; kitsíínawátsookoaayi matápiiksi the people elected you as chiefs.
iini: preoccupation with something, resulting in neglect of another activity; noohkáyaakomatotoohpommaawa ki áíiniisina’siwa she was supposed to go shopping, but instead she kept busy; annóhk nítohkotta’pao’taki, ki nitáíinisttso’kini at this time, I could be working, but I am too hungry; nitsiníísina’si nisóotamssawohkottohpo’kioo I was so preoccupied with keeping busy that I was unable to go.
iiníí: bison, Latin: Bison bison; ómahksiniiksi/ ómahkaiiniiksi big buffaloes; nitsíniimiksi my buffaloes.
iinik: agressively, abusively/tough; iiníkksi’poyiwa he scolded; áínikkihka’siwa he’s acting tough.
iinikímm: have an appearance; see saokiipisatsiinikimm prairie onion; Rel stem: vii iinikim have appearance; Note: adt req.
iinió’tokaan: buffalo skull; dialect var. ainió’tokaan; cf. iinii+mo’tokaan. iinissi vai; hyperventilate from laughing or crying; iiníssit! hyperventilate! (e.g. would be used when jeering someone who is laughing at you); áaksinissiwa she will …; iiníssiwa he hyperventilated; nitsiníssi I hyperventilated.
iinísskimm: buffalo stone (a stone thought to possess powers); iinísskimmiksi buffalo stones.
iinohk: last/ at the very end; (m)íínohkóóhtsi the last place; iinohkópiiwa/ itsíínohkópiiwa he sits at the last place.
iinóhpinsoyii: Northern oriole, Latin: Icterus galbula; iinóhpinsoyiiksi orioles.
iipakssoa’tsimio’p: rough-legged hawk (lit.: we have wide tail feathers), Latin: Buteo lagopus; íípakssóa’tsimio’piksi rough-legged hawks.
iipisówaahs: Morning Star; paahkopisówaahsa false Morning Star.
iipistotsi: decrease the amount of (said of a workload); iipístotsit! decrease the volume of your work!; áaksiipistotsima anniistsi astotóóhsiistsi otáísttsikááhkii’pistsi she will decrease the load of clothes that she is ironing; iipístotsima he lightened his workload, e.g. of papers; nitsíípistotsii’pa I decreased it (the workload); Rel. stems: vai iipistotaki, vta iipistoto decrease the amount of (something), decrease the amount of.
iisóítahtaa: shore of a river; cf. iso+niitahtaa; Note: gender uncertain.
iisto: pronominal base; kiistówaawa you (plural); niistówa I; ostóyi he/she.
iitáíhtsiiyo’p: sweatlodge; cf. ihtsiiyi. iitáíhtsootsiiyo’p nin; cemetery; cf. ihtsii.
iitáíksistokomssakio’p: kettle for boiling water; iitáíksistokomssakio’piksi kettles for boiling water; cf. iksistokomssaki. iitáínnihtao’p nan; cooking pot (lit.: where one boils); iitáínnihtao’piksi cooking pots; cf. innihtaa. iitáípa’ksiksini’kaayi pákki’pistsi nin; September (lit.: when cherries are mushy (from being over-ripe)); also iitáípa’ksikihkaayi pákki’pistsi when cherries are soft.
iitáípisao’p: container for boiling food over an open fire; iitáípisao’piksi containers for boiling food over an open fire; cf. opisaa. iitáísaamia’yao’p nan; floor-covering, rug; iitáísaamia’yao’piksi rugs; cf. isaamia’yi.
iitáísaipoyi: Standoff (AB); cf. it+a+sa+ipoyi. iitaisap adt; inside; see itssap.
iitáísapahtsimao’p: ashtray; iitáísapahtsimao’piksi ashtrays; cf. sapahtsimaa; Note: nin in North Piikani dialect.
iitáísapayi’sipisao’p: storage container used for carrying liquids, e.g. canteen, thermos; iitáísapayi’sipisao’pistsi storage containers used for carrying liquids; cf. sap+wayi’sipisaa.
iitáísapa’soyinnimao’p: bin for grains/ grain elevator; iitáísapa’soyinnimao’pistsi grain elevators; cf. wa’soyinni. iitáísapiistsinimao’p nan; ashtray; iitáísapiistsinimao’piksi ashtrays.
iitáísapinnihtao’p: cooking pot (lit.: that in which one boils food); iitáísapinnihtao’piksi cooking pots; cf. innihtaa. iitáísapiooyo’so’p nan; cooking pot; cf. sap+ooyo’si.
iitáísápiooyááttstao’p: bin, manger; iitáísápiooyááttstao’pistsi mangers; cf. sap+ooyi+ ?
iitáísápohkimao’p: cistern/ water tank; iitáísápohkimao’piksi cisterns; dialect var. iitáísápahkamao’p; cf. sapohkimaa.
iitáísapópaoo’p: car/ container or receptacle one sits in; ómahkitáísapópao’piksi big cars; cf. sapopii. iitáísapssáakio’p  nin; sink (lit.: wherein one washes dishes); iitáíssapssáakio’pistsi sinks; cf. iitaisap+ssaaki. iitáísapssítsimao’p nin; cradle, wherein one places a baby; itáísapssítsimao’pistsi cradles.
iitáísapsssiiststakio’p: washtub; iitáísapsssiiststakio’piksi washtubs; omahkitáísapsssiiststakio’pa big washtub; cf. sap+ssiiststaki. iitáísátsaakio’p nin; carpenter’s bench; iitáísátsaakio’pistsi carpenter’s benches; cf. aisatsaaki.
iitáísííkaaso’p: mat (lit.: where one wipes his feet); iitáísííkaaso’pistsi mats; cf. siikaasi.
iitáísokihtakio’p: shelf; iitáísokihtakio’pistsi shelves; cf. sok+ihtaki. iitáísokinakio’p nin; hospital; ómahkitáísokinakio’pistsi big hospitals; cf. sokinaki.
iitáísokohko’so’p: cupboard (lit.: where we put dishes nicely); iitáísokohko’so’pistsi cupboards; nitsitáísokohko’sspi my cupboard; cf. sok+ko’s.
iitáísooko’so’p: womb; otsítaisooko’sspi her womb; cf. so.+oko’si. iitáísootsi’kao’p nin; slide (lit.: where we slide); iitáísootsi’kao’pistsi slides. iitáísooyo’p nin; table; iitáísooyo’pistsi tables; cf. iso+ooyi.
iitáíssáakio’p: where one washes dishes; cf. ssaaki. iitáíssiiststakio’p nin; laundromat, laundry room; cf. ssiiststaki. iitáísskimao’p nan; steel sharpener; pokitáísskimao’piksi small steel sharpeners; syn. sskimaa’tsis; cf. sskimaa. iitáíssksinima’tstohkio’p nin; school; cf. ssksinima’tstohki.
iitáísstoyihtakio’p: refrigerator; iitáísstoyihtakio’piksi refrigerators; nitsítaisstoyihtakihpa where I place s.t. for cold storage; dialect var. iitáísstoyihtao’p; cf. ihtaki.
iitáísttsinao’p: ration day/ Wednesday (So. Piikani dialect); cf. isttsinaa. iitáítsiiyiiso’p nin; vision quest site; dialect var. iitáítsíiy’so’p; cf. itsiiyisi.
iitáí’poyo’p: courthouse (lit.: a place where one talks); iitáí’poyo’pistsi courthouses; cf. i’poyi.
iitáí’nssimao’p: field, garden plot (lit.: where one plants); cf. i’nssimaa. iitáí’tssksoyo’p nin; picnic ground (lit.: where one eats in the open); iitáí’tssksoyo’pistsi picnic grounds; cf. i’tssksoyi. iitaam adt; happily; idiolectal var. i’taam. iitáóhkanaikokotoyi niítahtaistsi nin; November (lit.: when all the rivers freeze); cf. ohkana+ikokoto.
iitáóhkanáóo’p: Walmart (lit.: where we gather); cf. ohkanoo. iitáóhkipistao’p nan; team horse/ work horse; iitáóhkipistao’piksi team horses; cf. ohkipistaa.
iitáóhkohtao’p: November (lit.: when one gathers wood); cf. ohkohtaa. iitáóhpommao’p nin; store (lit.: where one buys); iitáóhpommao’pistsi stores; cf. ohpommaa.
iitáóhpommootsiiyo’p: trading place; cf. ohpommo+otsiiyi. iitáókakihtsimao’p nin; courtroom; cf. okakihtsimaa.
iitáókstsimao’p: a type of counter (e.g. an odometer); syn. akstsima’tsis; cf. okstsimaa.
iitáómatapapitsitsissko: September (lit.: when the leaves change color); dialect var. iitaomatapapitsitssko.
iitáómiiyáóo’p: woodpile/ where one piles firewood; iitáómiiyaoo’pistsi woodpiles; dialect var. iitáómi(a)o’p; cf. mamiiyi. iitáópaoo’pa nin; seat, where one sits; cf. opii. iitáópiaapikksso’p nin; landing strip; cf. opiaapikkssi.
iitáó’tsstoyii: November (lit.: when cold weather arrives); cf. o’t+sstoyii iitawááhkiitao’pi nin; gas station, service station.
iitawáakohsimao’p: kettle; iitawáakohsimao’piksi boiling pots; cf. waakohsi.
iitawáánao’kso’kii’p: Wednesday (lit.: when it is half closed (refers to when stores used to be closed for half a day on Wednesdays)); Iitawáánao’kso’kii’pistsi Wednesdays.
iitáwaatsímoyihkao’p: church/temple; cf. waatsimoyihkaa. iitawááwao’píniisao’p nin; swing; iitawááwao’píniisao’pistsi swings; cf. waawao’piniisi.
iitawáí’pihtakio’p: truck/ hauling vehicle; ómahkitawai’pihtakio’piksi big trucks; cf. wai’pihtaki.
iitawanssa: smoked tanned hide; iitawánssaiksi smoked tanned hides; nitótawanssawa my smoked tanned hide/ that hide which I smoked and tanned.
iitáyaakihtsootssp: graveyard/cemetery (lit.: where we are laid to rest); iitáyaakihtsootsspistsi graveyards; cf. yaakihtsiiyi.
iitáyiitsimaahkao’p: August (lit.: when we prepare food for storage); iitáyiitsimaahkao’pistsi Augusts; cf. yiitsimaahkaa.
iitáyo’kiaakio’p: jail (lit.: a place for shutting in); iitáyó’kiaakio’pistsi jails; cf. yo’ki.
iita’pio’kii: lock; nííta’pió’kiit anni kitsími! lock the door!; áakiitá’pió’kima osóókayisi she will lock her suitcase; niitá’pió’kimáyi he locked it; nitsííta’pió’kii’pa nookóówayi I locked my house.
iitopóniaakio’p: the time of starvation/famine (lit.: when we starved); cf. oponiaaki.
iitsiksist: slow; iitsíksistokska’siwa he ran slowly; see iitsiksista’pii. iitsiksista’pii vii; be slow; áakiitsiksista’piiwa it will be slow; iikíítsiksista’piiwa amoyi pásskaani this dance is very slow; Rel. stem: vai iitsíksista’pssi be slow.
iitsimaahkaan: stored food; nitsíítsimaahkaanistsi my stored foods; otsíítsimaahkaani his stored food.
iitsimaan: food kept in a parfleche; iitsimáánistsi parfleches of food.
iitsimaisskinitsimaan: food storage bag; otsiitsimáísskinítsimaanistsi his food storage bags. iitsínnisi’yi soyóópokiistsi nin; November (lit.: when leaves fall).
iitsisóóminnio’p: shoulder blade; iitsisóóminnio’piksi shoulder blades; nitsitsisóóminnihpa my shoulder blade; aissáákstamohtsinihkit iitsisóóminnio’pa! sing well! (lit.: just try to sing with the shoulder blade). iitsittsimaan nin; meat (cut) for drying; íítsittsimaanistsi meats cut for drying. iitsi’poyi vai; speak Blackfoot (or other aboriginal language); niitsí’poyit! speak Blackfoot!; áakiitsi’poyiwa she will speak Blackfoot; iitsí’poyiwa he spoke Blackfoot; nitsíítsi’poyi I spoke Blackfoot; cf. niit+i’poyi; Rel. stem: vta iitsi’powat speak Blackfoot to.
iitska’si: disguise one’s (detrimental) state or condition; iitská’sit! pretend (to be sober, e.g.)!; áaksiitska’siwa she will try to hide (s.t., e.g. her illness); iitská’siwa he pretended (that he was not shy, e.g.); nitsíítska’si I pretended (that I was not in pain, e.g.); sskáí’yikaattsiiyiwa stónnatsiitska’siwa he was extremely drunk, he tried excessively hard to disguise it.
iitskimaan: aggressive, blunt, tactless; íítskimaananiiwa he tactlessly said s.t.; áakiitskimaanitapiwa he will be a blunt, aggressive person.
